channel.title: The New York Times Trends
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title: Breaking News: A 5-year-old boy was pulled from a 100-foot well in Morocco after being trapped for four days. His condition is unclear. https://t.co/ZPzuwaYoEi
Breaking News: The 5-year-old boy pulled from a well in Morocco has died, state media reported. The boy, named Rayan, had been trapped for four days. https://t.co/KabIwtrhPo

A judge in Virginia on Friday handed down a temporary ruling that seven school districts could keep their mask mandates in place — a setback to Gov. Glenn Youngkin, who had signed an executive order making masks optional in public schools. https://t.co/AttVcZ1WLt

As many as 70 episodes of “The Joe Rogan Experience” have been quietly removed in recent days by Spotify, listeners say. Neither Rogan nor Spotify has given an explanation. On Saturday, he apologized for using a racial slur numerous times in past episodes. https://t.co/5YhcjKZyFr https://t.co/sFGPuyg5V1
What makes these chocolate chip cookies truly perfect isn’t anything radical; it’s simply an attention to detail. https://t.co/YELs1kI38c https://t.co/oN5BHBFWLM

Spotify has quietly removed dozens of episodes of Joe Rogan's podcast, listeners said this week, and Rogan himself apologized early Saturday in an Instagram post for his use of a racial slur in past episodes. https://t.co/7IWuiyALWb
Breaking News: U.S. employers added 467,000 jobs in January, hiring that showed the economy’s resilience in the face of record coronavirus cases. https://t.co/q0llqxswP2

The operation to save Rayan, a 5-year-old boy who fell to the bottom of a well in Morocco this week, is in its “final stages,” the state-run news agency said. Rescuers have sent him oxygen and water, and videos appeared to show him still breathing. https://t.co/YOzz7Xe8gf

A Pennsylvania doctor accused of prescribing ivermectin and hydroxychloroquine to treat Covid-19, two drugs that regulators have called not safe for treating the disease, was fired. https://t.co/Kzgn5HoPwJ

More than 2,600 Americans are dying from Covid-19 each day, an alarming rate that has climbed by 30% in the past two weeks. Across the U.S., the coronavirus pandemic has now claimed more than 900,000 lives. https://t.co/Q998VOjNp4 https://t.co/d6eV4RTaYN

The speaker of the Republican-controlled Arizona House — who supported Donald Trump in 2020 — just torpedoed a bill that would have let lawmakers reject the results of an election. https://t.co/3yMKIhCNC4
The chief executive of Delta Air Lines wants the U.S. government to put unruly passengers on a federal no-fly list that would bar them from commercial flights. https://t.co/E62pcKbfCm

Breaking News: More than 2,600 people in the U.S. are dying from Covid-19 each day, an alarming death rate that has climbed by 30% in the last two weeks. Across the nation, the pandemic has now claimed about 900,000 lives. https://t.co/LfN3ExdX61
Breaking News: North Carolina’s Supreme Court said the state’s political maps were illegally skewed to favor Republicans, requiring lawmakers to make new ones. https://t.co/9hKKZKXwRy

The Ukrainian military is training civilians to help defend against a possible Russian invasion and occupation. Our cameras went inside a training center in the southeastern city of Mariupol. https://t.co/aIDPRS996S https://t.co/e1Bv7X5z5H
Former Vice President Mike Pence on Friday rejected Donald Trump's false claim that Pence had the right to overturn the 2020 election. https://t.co/pcrFih7sqB https://t.co/JOpfRpyLBg

Breaking News: Former Vice President Mike Pence rejected Donald Trump's false claim that Pence had the right to overturn the 2020 election. “President Trump is wrong,” he said to the Federalist Society, a conservative legal organization. https://t.co/oGJpUB9nky
Breaking News: Michael Avenatti was convicted of wire fraud and identity theft for stealing nearly $300,000 from his former client Stormy Daniels. https://t.co/nVdF8q6xXl

The Republican Party has officially declared the Jan. 6 attack "legitimate political discourse." It is the party's most forceful effort yet to minimize the riot as well as the attempt by Donald Trump and his allies to invalidate the 2020 election. https://t.co/xxJNTOKAmH https://t.co/k4m8hRfSl1

Breaking News: The Republican Party officially declared the Jan. 6 attack on the Capitol “legitimate political discourse” and censured two of its own members, Representatives Liz Cheney and Adam Kinzinger, for investigating it. https://t.co/h05eFfHvs1

Team USA entered the National Stadium in Beijing for the #OpeningCeremony of the 2022 Winter Olympics.
Brittany Bowe was one of the flag-bearers, replacing the bobsledder Elana Meyers Taylor, who tested positive for Covid. https://t.co/xVHK270hJ0 https://t.co/seULnOB7mU

The Olympic Parade of Nations began, as always, with Greece.
The other teams at the #Beijing2022 opening ceremony will enter based on their order in the Chinese language. The U.S. will be the 56th to enter the stadium.
Follow our updates. https://t.co/WblMarrKyh https://t.co/IsJbWl5yZV

Pita Taufatofua, the Tongan athlete and famed flag bearer, will not compete in the #Beijing2022 Winter Olympics — instead, he is focusing on the disaster response to the volcanic eruption and tsunami that struck his native island nation. https://t.co/QTHpnO6vvx

A Florida teenager said that Elon Musk offered him $5,000 to stop tracking his private jet and posting its location on Twitter. He countered: How about $50,000? Or a Tesla Model 3? Or an internship?
The exchange went silent after Jan. 23. https://t.co/hdgk43YdD3 https://t.co/FRlb5RY3sg

Tech giants are feeling the effects of Apple making it harder to track people online. This week, Meta said those changes cost it billions this year. Then its stock price fell more than 26% on Thursday, wiping more than $230 billion off its market value. https://t.co/Zndm95xB7H

A teacher at a New York Jewish school was asked last summer about a blog post she had written criticizing Israel.
The teacher, who is Jewish, told her boss she would not discuss politics in class, and he praised her. A week later, she was fired. https://t.co/jNKRsns2hn

A Biden administration official said the ISIS leader Abu Ibrahim al-Hashimi al-Qurayshi died at the start of a U.S. raid in Syria when he blew himself up with an explosive that also took out members of his family. At least 13 were killed in the operation. https://t.co/uT4WXE6m0v

President Biden will set out a “moonshot” plan to cut the U.S. death rate from cancer by at least 50% over the next 25 years. The president will also announce a campaign to urge people to undergo screenings that were missed during the pandemic. https://t.co/94MvT13Avs
The U.S. has exposed what it says is a Russian plan to use a fake video to create a pretext to invade Ukraine, senior officials said. https://t.co/S9aMp4lAYH

In a lawsuit, Alexander Vindman accused Donald Trump Jr., Rudy Giuliani, and two other top Trump White House aides of running a coordinated intimidation and retaliation campaign to stop him from testifying in Donald Trump’s first impeachment trial. https://t.co/ThNWh5kTQq

Breaking News: U.S. forces killed the leader of ISIS, Abu Ibrahim al-Hashimi al-Qurayshi, in a raid in northwest Syria, President Biden said.
Follow our updates. https://t.co/tCwm3hwRd5

Thousands of police officers lined the sides of Fifth Avenue in New York City, standing at attention a dozen rows deep as bagpipe players, police vehicles and emergency trucks accompanied the hearse carrying Officer Wilbert Mora's casket. https://t.co/0AD7PW38e9 https://t.co/pSU7FYuE5m

All seven House Republicans who voted to impeach Donald Trump and are seeking re-election have out-raised their primary opponents, many of whom have received Trump’s backing, according to campaign disclosures filed with the Federal Election Commission. https://t.co/z0Ob4T5DYt

Two years into the pandemic, the coronavirus is killing Americans at far higher rates than people in other wealthy nations.
The ballooning death toll has defied the hopes that the less severe Omicron variant would spare the U.S. the pain of past waves. https://t.co/Ie4YT3jLlI https://t.co/dQNEz06px3

U.S. soldiers who have not yet been vaccinated against the coronavirus will be immediately discharged, the Army said on Wednesday, joining other military branches that have already begun doing so. A vast majority of troops are inoculated, the Army said. https://t.co/z2xy4yHrhP

A senior House Democrat called on Wednesday for the resignation of Louis DeJoy, the postmaster general, saying he flouted President Biden’s plan to electrify the federal fleet by placing a multibillion-dollar order for mostly gasoline-powered vehicles. https://t.co/Qt2ymyq1RH

Amy Schneider's winning streak set a record for women on "Jeopardy!" She also became a fan favorite, and to some, a new transgender icon. @Jeopardamy discusses her life, the show and what’s next with @shaneisland. Join us Wednesday at 5:30 p.m. ET.
https://t.co/S3VB5VYARe

Breaking News: Jeff Zucker resigned as the president of CNN, writing in a memo that he had failed to disclose a romantic relationship with another senior executive at the company. The relationship came up during the network’s investigation into Chris Cuomo.https://t.co/ksaYyL7SwX

“Death rates are so high in the States — eye-wateringly high,” a global public health expert said. Despite having one of the world’s most powerful arsenals of vaccines, the U.S. has failed to inoculate as much of its population as other wealthy nations. https://t.co/wj5vcBTi9w
The U.S. has a far higher Covid death rate than other wealthy nations, reflecting lagging vaccinations and other weaknesses. https://t.co/fM9jkv4vxM

Feral pigs in the San Francisco Bay Area are tearing up lawns, threatening the drinking water and disturbing vineyard harvests. They're part of what one federal official called a "feral swine bomb" — and many people want them dead. https://t.co/smZ4xQ8hi1

Amy Schneider's winning streak set a record for women on "Jeopardy!" She also became a fan favorite, and to some, a new transgender icon. @Jeopardamy discusses her life, the show and what’s next with @shaneisland. Join us Wednesday at 5:30 p.m. ET.
https://t.co/Qf5ZzS4qT5

Breaking News: Tom Brady announced his retirement from the NFL, ending an unparalleled 22-year career with seven Super Bowl titles and three MVP awards. https://t.co/RWWRoil6ZL https://t.co/WxaZ48cZ0q

A long-awaited report on parties in Downing Street during the pandemic dealt Prime Minister Boris Johnson a stinging blow on Monday, condemning him for failed leadership and painting a damning picture of "excessive" workplace drinking. https://t.co/QMQWxWip5g https://t.co/9nXal69hwL

Donald Trump was more involved than previously known in proposals to seize voting machines over baseless claims of election fraud in 2020, new accounts show. The plans explored using national security agencies to take control of the machines. https://t.co/vTXEd15rKi

The photographer Claire Thomas found solace in the picturesque countryside of her homeland in Wales, where herds of wild mountain ponies have roamed freely among the hills for centuries.
See her photos here: https://t.co/LcMNKsnpPz https://t.co/UPYZsF74Km
Breaking News: Donald Trump was more involved than previously known in proposals to seize voting machines over baseless claims of fraud in 2020, new accounts show. https://t.co/kYBJk1PKcZ

Breaking News: Pfizer and its partner BioNTech are expected to ask the FDA as soon as Tuesday to authorize its Covid vaccine for children 6 months to 4 years old as a two-dose regimen. https://t.co/Kok4Ff81cx
The hit game Wordle has been purchased by the New York Times Company for a price "in the low seven figures," the company said. https://t.co/XZhY6kW3mv
Spotify said it would enforce its rules about Covid misinformation and add an advisory, but would not take the position of a “content censor.” https://t.co/LFQIZdDaQ9
